qas.question: What county is Tuscon located in?
What was the population of Tuscon in 2006?
what were veterans in need of after World War I?
What did the U.S. Veterans Administration build around 1910?
What was the population of Tuscon in 1940?

context: By 1900, <a5_0>7,531<a5_0/> people lived in the city. The population increased gradually to <a6_0>13,913<a6_0/> in 1910. At about this time, the U.S. Veterans Administration had begun construction on the present <a3_0>Veterans Hospital<a3_0/>. Many veterans who had been gassed in World War I and were in need of <a2_0>respiratory therapy<a2_0/> began coming to Tucson after the war, due to the clean dry air. Over the following years the city continued to grow, with the population increasing to <a7_0>20,292<a7_0/> in 1920 and <a4_0><a8_0>36,818<a8_0/><a4_0/> in 1940. In 2006 the population of <a0_0>Pima County<a0_0/>, in which Tucson is located, passed one million while the City of Tucson's population was <a1_0><a9_0>535,000<a9_0/><a1_0/>.
